docs.lead_paragraph: The conversation sparked by Amy Julia Becker's guest post last week about her decision not to have prenatal testing is still going strong. One of the many themes in the comments is the "burden" -- and the differing perceptions of that word -- of raising a child with Down syndrome in particular and with disabilities in general.

headline.main: Is It Harder to Have a Child with Down Syndrome?

docs.lead_paragraph: "As the World Turns,'' the CBS soap opera with more divorces in its history than, surely, the entire city of Reno, ended for good on Friday after 54 years on television and a prior life on radio. At this commemorative moment it is worth pointing out that a number of now-famous actors appeared on the series including Meg Ryan, Julianne Moore, Steven Weber and Marisa Tomei. Amazingly enough, the last three appear together in this scene of love gone brutally, badly and tediously wrong: Not only does this clip egregiously fail to suggest the talent of Julianne Moore in "Vanya on 42nd Street;'' it fails to telegraph the talent of Steven Weber in "Wings.''

headline.main: A Fond Farewell to 'As the World Turns'

docs.abstract: Though generally more conservative in its tone than some of its counterparts like "All My Children,'' "As the World Turns" did have its milestones.
docs.snippet: Though generally more conservative in its tone than some of its counterparts like "All My Children,'' "As the World Turns" did have its milestones.
